headline.print_headline: Minnesota Man Charged in 2009 Murder of 12-Year-Old Chicago Girl
headline.main: Minnesota Man Charged in 2009 Murder of 12-Year-Old Chicago Girl

docs.snippet: Chicago police said on Wednesday they charged a Minnesota man in the 2009 rape and murder of a 12-year-old Chicago girl on the basis of DNA evidence from another rape case....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chicago police said on Wednesday they charged a Minnesota man in the 2009 rape and murder of a 12-year-old Chicago girl on the basis of DNA evidence from another rape case.

headline.sub: Farmers increase bio-security to combat deadly pig virus
headline.main: Farmers increase bio-security to combat deadly pig virus

docs.snippet: Pig farmers in the U.S. are working to protect their pigs from the deadly Porcine Epidemic Diarrhea virus (PEDv). This comes as the EU toughens rules on pig imports. Jillian Kitchener reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pig farmers in the U.S. are working to protect their pigs from the deadly Porcine Epidemic Diarrhea virus (PEDv). This comes as the EU toughens rules on pig imports. Jillian Kitchener reports.

docs.snippet: Forty-four percent of Americans said they believed that there is solid evidence the temperature on earth is getting warmer mostly because of human activity....
docs.lead_paragraph: Forty-four percent of Americans said they believed that there is solid evidence the temperature on earth is getting warmer mostly because of human activity.

headline.print_headline: Iran, Six Powers Hold 'Useful' Nuclear Talks; Agreement Elusive
headline.main: Iran, Six Powers Hold 'Useful' Nuclear Talks; Agreement Elusive

docs.snippet: Iran and six world powers held more "useful" talks on Tehran's nuclear program, the European Union announced on Wednesday, as a Western diplomat said they are still struggling to overcome deep disagreements on the future of Iranian atomic capabili...
docs.lead_paragraph: Iran and six world powers held more "useful" talks on Tehran's nuclear program, the European Union announced on Wednesday, as a Western diplomat said they are still struggling to overcome deep disagreements on the future of Iranian atomic capabilities.

headline.print_headline: Investors Bet on Return to Reverse Mortgages
headline.main: Some Investors Bet on Return to Reverse Mortgages

docs.snippet: A reverse mortgage start-up based in New Jersey has raised about $230 million in a private offering, which sets the stage for a potential initial public offering....
docs.abstract: A reverse mortgage start-up based in New Jersey has raised about $230 million in a private offering, which sets the stage for a potential initial public offering.

headline.print_headline: Growing Pains for a Goldman Sachs Fund
headline.main: Growing Pains for a Goldman Sachs Fund

docs.snippet: The bank, which surprised some on Wall Street when it created a new version of its Petershill investment fund, has had a hard time attracting investors....
docs.abstract: The bank, which surprised some on Wall Street when it created a new version of its Petershill investment fund, has had a hard time attracting investors.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Senator Landrieu Questions Republican Commitment to Keystone
headline.main: U.S. Senator Landrieu Questions Republican Commitment to Keystone

docs.snippet: Democratic U.S. Senator Mary Landrieu accused Republicans on Wednesday of being more interested in exploiting the long-delayed Keystone XL oil pipeline project as an election issue than in voting to build it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic U.S. Senator Mary Landrieu accused Republicans on Wednesday of being more interested in exploiting the long-delayed Keystone XL oil pipeline project as an election issue than in voting to build it.

headline.print_headline: National Australia Bank Posts 16 Pct Profit Hike
headline.main: National Australia Bank Posts 16 Pct Profit Hike

docs.snippet: National Australia Bank Ltd., one of Australia's biggest lenders, on Thursday posted a 16 percent increase in half-year profit to 2.86 billion Australian dollars ($2.67 billion), helped by a reduction in bad debts and an improving British economy....
docs.lead_paragraph: National Australia Bank Ltd., one of Australia's biggest lenders, on Thursday posted a 16 percent increase in half-year profit to 2.86 billion Australian dollars ($2.67 billion), helped by a reduction in bad debts and an improving British economy.

headline.sub: Tesla stock falls despite earnings beat
headline.main: Tesla stock falls despite earnings beat

docs.snippet: Elon Musk's luxury electric car maker reported earnings that were better-than-forecasts, but investors fled on a a disappointing second quarter outlook. Bobbi Rebell reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk's luxury electric car maker reported earnings that were better-than-forecasts, but investors fled on a a disappointing second quarter outlook. Bobbi Rebell reports.

headline.print_headline: Minnesota Man Failed to Disclose Crimes in Bosnia: Indictment
headline.main: Minnesota Man Failed to Disclose Crimes in Bosnia: Indictment

docs.snippet: A Minnesota man has been charged with immigration fraud for failing to disclose his military service in Bosnia-Herzegovina during the war there in the 1990s or crimes he committed including murder, U.S. authorities said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Minnesota man has been charged with immigration fraud for failing to disclose his military service in Bosnia-Herzegovina during the war there in the 1990s or crimes he committed including murder, U.S. authorities said on Wednesday.
